# Description of DataSchema variable 

* Short name: `sex`
* Variable label: `biological sex`
* Variable description: `participant's biological sex`
* Domain: `Socio-demographic and economic characteristics`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | female
1        | male

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

# Data process

## CHARLS: China (All counties with the exception of Tibet)

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description



* Name: `rgender`
* Label: `Gender`
* Categories: 
    + `1 = Male`
    + `2 = Female`
* Description:
```{r assign1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w1_sex2','CHARLS.demographic_background_wave1',
                         variables=list('rgender'), missings = TRUE)
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w1_id','CHARLS.CHARLS_w1_ids',
                         variables=list('var'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local1, echo=FALSE}
CHARLS_w1_sex2 <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w1_sex2')
CHARLS_w1_id <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w1_id')
CHARLS_w1_sex2$oldid <- CHARLS_w1_sex2$id
CHARLS_w1_sex2$id <- CHARLS_ids(ids = CHARLS_w1_sex2$oldid)

Add_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], oldid=as.numeric(new_2[,3]), rgender=as.numeric(new_2[,2]))
  new_22
}

CHARLS_w1_sex <- Add_indiv(old = CHARLS_w1_sex2, new = CHARLS_w1_id)

vari <- CHARLS_w1_sex$rgender
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(CHARLS_w1_sex, aes(x=factor(rgender))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("sex") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `2 Female into 0`
* `keep Male into 1`

There is a value 0 in the study-specific variable that we are taking as missing (999).


**R script:**

```{r harmo1, echo=TRUE}
CHARLS_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=CHARLS_w1_sex$id)
CHARLS_ds_w1$sex <- car::recode(CHARLS_w1_sex$rgender, "2=0; 0=999; NA=999")
CHARLS_ds_w1$sex <- labelled(CHARLS_ds_w1$sex, labels = c("Female"=0, "Male"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- CHARLS_ds_w1$sex
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(CHARLS_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(sex))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("sex") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation1, echo=FALSE}
AfterH <- table(CHARLS_ds_w1$sex)
BeforeH <- table(CHARLS_w1_sex$rgender)
BeforeH <- c(BeforeH[3], BeforeH[2], sum(c(BeforeH[1],sum(is.na(CHARLS_w1_sex$rgender)))))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2->0","1", "(NA,0)->999")
kable(C)
```

#### Study-specific variable description

* Name: `rgender`

```{r assign2, echo=FALSE}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w2_sex2','CHARLS.Demographic_Background_wave2',

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w2_id','CHARLS.CHARLS_w2_ids',
```

```{r local2, echo=FALSE}
CHARLS_w1_sex2 <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w1_sex2')
CHARLS_w2_id <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w2_id')
CHARLS_w2_sex2 <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w2_sex2')

CHARLS_w1_sex2$oldid <- CHARLS_w1_sex2$id
CHARLS_w1_sex2$id <- CHARLS_ids(ids = CHARLS_w1_sex2$oldid)

Add_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], rgender=as.numeric(new_2[,2]))
  new_22
}

CHARLS_w1_sex22 <- Add_indiv(old = CHARLS_w1_sex2, new = CHARLS_w2_id)




Add_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(rep(NA, dim(new)[1]*dim(new)[2] ), nrow = dim(new)[1])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], ba000_w2_3=as.numeric(new_2[,2]))
  new_22
}

CHARLS_w2_sex <- Add_indiv(old = CHARLS_w2_sex2, new = CHARLS_w2_id)
CHARLS_w2_sex$rgender_w1 <- CHARLS_w1_sex22$rgender
CHARLS_w2_sex$proff <- CHARLS_w2_sex$ba000_w2_3 - CHARLS_w2_sex$rgender_w1

#There are 118 individuals that has discrepancies between sex in wave 1 and 2.
mistakes_ind <- CHARLS_w2_sex[which(CHARLS_w2_sex$proff!=0 & !is.na(CHARLS_w2_sex$proff)),] 


vari <- CHARLS_w2_sex$rgender_w1
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(CHARLS_w2_sex, aes(x=factor(rgender_w1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("sex") + ylab("Frequency")

vari <- CHARLS_w2_sex$ba000_w2_3
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(CHARLS_w2_sex, aes(x=factor(ba000_w2_3))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("sex") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable from wave 2 it has to be recoded as follows:

* `2 Female into 0`
* `keep Male into 1`

The missing values in the study-specific variable from wave 2 are going to be completed with the study-specific variable from wave 1 if it is possible.
The 118 individuals with discrepancies between wave 1 and 2 are going to be computed as in wave 2 and when we will have wave 3 we will decide. 

**R script:**

```{r harmo2, echo=TRUE}
CHARLS_w2_sex$sex <- CHARLS_w2_sex$ba000_w2_3
CHARLS_w2_sex$sex[is.na(CHARLS_w2_sex$sex)] <- CHARLS_w2_sex$rgender_w1[is.na(CHARLS_w2_sex$sex)]

CHARLS_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=CHARLS_w2_sex$id)
CHARLS_ds_w2$sex <- car::recode(CHARLS_w2_sex$sex, "2=0; 0=999; NA=999")
CHARLS_ds_w2$sex <- labelled(CHARLS_ds_w2$sex, labels = c("Female"=0, "Male"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript2, echo=FALSE}
vari <- CHARLS_ds_w2$sex
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(CHARLS_ds_w2, aes(x=factor(sex))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("sex") + ylab("Frequency")
```
